text: Talal bin Abdulaziz Al Saud (15 August 1931 â€“ 22 December 2018), formerly also called The Red Prince, was a senior member of the Saudi royal family. He was known for his liberal stance. He supported a national Constitution, the full rule of law and equality before the law. He was also the leader of Free Princes Movement. His father was Ibn Saud. Prince Talal bin Abdul Aziz Al Saud died on 22 December 2018 in Riyadh, aged 87. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Saudi princes and princesses Category:Civil rights activists
title: Talal bin Abdulaziz
